result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony L Crudup was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony L Crudup in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Anthony L Crudup in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Court sentences defendant to serve 100 days in the House of Correction with credit for 100 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court will waive non-mandatory costs and surcharges.  Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.  Mandatory costs and surcharges to be paid by 4/5/2018 or a civil judgment will be entered against the defendant.  

Filed:
Pre-trial incarceration credit form
Notice of right to seek post-conviction relief
Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights/addendum.
